abstract: Beijing officials adjust policy on air pollution after red alert virtually shut city down in December 2015; new guidelines would raise threshold for alerts to prevent social and economic disruption, despite city's air quality ranking among world's worst; proposal to build ventilation corridors across city draws mixed reaction.
lead_paragraph: The change in how the air quality alerts would be applied highlights officials’ worries about the social disruption they can cause.

headline.main: Beijing to Raise Threshold on Red Alerts for Smog
headline.print_headline: To Limit Disruption, Beijing Raises Threshold on Red Alerts for Air Pollution

snippet: The change in how the air quality alerts would be applied highlights officials’ worries about the social disruption they can cause.
